message.content:
cs.SE, cs.CR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.HC. 

The paper focuses on designing and evaluating an approach to support reviewing security-related aspects in agile requirements specifications of web applications. This involves the use of Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques to relate user stories to security properties and identify high-level security requirements from the Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP). The paper also evaluates the effectiveness and efficiency of the approach via two controlled experiment trials. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.SE (Software Engineering), followed by cs.CR (Cryptography and Security), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.LG (Machine Learning), and cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction).
